ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: one to two on the readings, plus 3 short but fairly thought-intensive papers - so another 20-30 each, maybe?
The papers were a lot of work especially the ones that were a smaller portion of the grade.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Loved the subject, the way it was presented and the instructor!
I really enjoyed this class. The subject was well presented, the size allowed for a great deal of interesting discussion, and the professor conducted class in a flexible but effective manner.

The material is very interesting. I think this class would benefit from a case method like used at SOM or in Health and Human Rights. Simply, rather than talking completely theoretically, the course could benefit from some more concrete examples.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Gorik Ooms  Amzing teacher. Organized, clear in his expectations, and always willing to discuss subject further.
Instructor: Gorik Ooms  Gorik is charming, intelligent, and obviously an authority in his field.
Instructor: Gorik Ooms  Gorik is a good professor, he could be a little more active in classes rather than relying wholly on class discussion. Also lectures became a little theoretical at times.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's lovely - the workload is fairly light but the course structure allowed for a lot of thinking and more in-depth work if you were interested, and the professor really made the class come to life.
